concise_definition: n. 堆, 堆积物; v. 堆叠, 堆积 (第三人称单数形式)

definitions.explanation_en: A large, untidy heap or stack of objects, often accumulated without order or arrangement.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指大量无序堆积在一起的物品，通常杂乱无章地堆叠而成。
definitions.example_en: There were piles of books on the floor, making it hard to walk through the room.
definitions.example_cn: 地板上堆着一大堆书，让人很难在房间里走动。

definitions.explanation_en: A long, sturdy post driven into the ground to support structures such as bridges, piers, or buildings, especially in soft or wet soil.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一根长而坚固的柱子，被打入地面以支撑桥梁、码头或建筑物，尤其用于松软或潮湿的土壤中。
definitions.example_en: The old pier was supported by wooden piles driven deep into the seabed.
definitions.example_cn: 这座旧码头由深入海底的木桩支撑。

definitions.explanation_en: To stack or accumulate things in a large, often untidy, heap.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将物品堆叠或堆积成大量、常杂乱无章的一堆。
definitions.example_en: She piled her clothes on the bed before packing for the trip.
definitions.example_cn: 她在打包旅行前把衣服堆在床上。

definitions.explanation_en: To drive or force something into a position, especially a post or stake into the ground.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将某物（尤其是柱子或木桩）强行打入某处，特别是地面中。
definitions.example_en: Workers piled the concrete supports into the riverbed to build the new bridge.
definitions.example_cn: 工人们将混凝土支撑桩打入河床，以建造新桥。

comparison.analysis: “Heap” (堆) 与 “pile” 非常接近，都指杂乱堆积的物体，但 “heap” 更强调无序和松散的状态，常带有负面含义；而 “pile” 可以是中性或正式用语，尤其在工程语境中专指结构支撑桩，这是 “heap” 所不具备的含义。
“Stack” (整齐的堆) 指有序、规则地叠放的物品，如书本、箱子，强调整齐性；而 “pile” 更常暗示杂乱、随意的堆积，两者在组织性上形成对比。
“Mound” (土丘) 通常指自然形成或人工堆起的隆起土堆，多用于地形描述，如坟墓或防御工事；而 “pile” 更广泛用于人造物的堆积，且可作动词使用，语义范围更广。
